name: df-ltbag
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(cltb, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, copab(s2, s3, wa(wss(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)), crab(s4, co(cn0, cmap, cv(s1)), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s4)), cn), cfn))), wrex(s5, cv(s1), wa(wbr(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s5)), clt, cfv(cv(s3), cv(s5))), wral(s6, cv(s1), wi(wbr(cv(s5), cv(s0), cv(s6)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s6)), cfv(cv(s3), cv(s6)))))))))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ <bag =(s0 âˆˆ ð•Œ, s1 âˆˆ ð•Œ â†¦ { < s2, s3 > |({ s2, s3 } âŠ† { s4 âˆˆ(â„•0[â†¦]s1)|(`' s4 " â„•)âˆˆ Fin } âˆ§ âˆƒ(s5 âˆˆ s1,((s2 ` s5)[<](s3 ` s5)âˆ§ âˆ€(s6 âˆˆ s1,(s5[s0]s6 â†’(s2 ` s6)=(s3 ` s6))))))})
comment: Define a well-order on the set of all finite bags from the index set ` i ` given a wellordering ` r ` of ` i ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.)
